Description: The Siege Tank is a transformative Terran mechanical unit produced from Factories with Tech Labs. It provides unparalleled area denial and positional control through its Siege Mode, which trades mobility for extreme range and devastating splash damage. The tank is fundamental to Terran mech compositions and frequently supplements bio armies for added firepower and defensive capabilities.

Ability.Name: Siege Mode
Ability.Description: Transforms into immobile siege mode with 13 range and area splash damage. Attacks deal bonus damage to Armored units.

Ability.Name: Unsiege
Ability.Description: Returns to mobile Tank Mode with 7 range and single-target damage.

Upgrade.Name: Smart Servos
Upgrade.Effect: Reduces transformation time between Tank Mode and Siege Mode by 50%

Competitive Usage.General: Siege Tanks excel at area denial and positional warfare, creating impassable zones for ground armies. They control chokepoints, defend expansions, and enable methodical map control. Effective tank usage requires vision support (Scans, Sensor Towers, spotting units) and screening forces (Marines, Hellbats) to protect against flanks and air threats. Smart Servos upgrade is crucial for tactical repositioning.
Competitive Usage.Vs. Terran: The cornerstone of TvT 'tank wars,' where positioning, vision, and air superiority determine engagements. Tank lines supported by Vikings and Liberators create powerful defensive formations and enable slow, methodical pushes across the map.
Competitive Usage.Vs. Protoss: Effective against gateway unit compositions and can pressure Protoss expansions. Vulnerable to Immortal focus fire, Disruptor shots, and air unit harassment. Often requires Marine and Mine support to handle various Protoss threats.
Competitive Usage.Vs. Zerg: Essential in mech compositions against Zerg, devastating against Ling/Bane armies and Roach/Ravager timings. Requires careful positioning with Hellbat support to avoid being overrun by flanking maneuvers or disabled by Vipers using Blinding Cloud and Abduct.
